resources.string:
DEFINITION : The glycemic index, simply put, is a measure of how quickly a food causes our blood sugar levels to rise. The measure ranks food on a scale of zero to 100. Foods with a high glycemic index, or GI, are quickly digested and absorbed, causing a rapid rise in blood sugar. //////////////////////////////////////************************/////////////////////////////// WHAT IS GOOD GLYCEMIC INDEX ???
55 or less = Low (good) 56- 69 = Medium. 70 or higher = High (bad)
